sen.j: 平 維衡（たいら の これひら、生没年不詳）は平安時代の武将。
sen.e: TAIRA no Korehira (dates of his birth and death unknown) was a busho (a Japanese military commander) during the Heian period.
TAIRA no Korehira (year of birth and death unknown) was a busho (a Japanese military commander) during the Heian period.
sen.cmt: 統一リストより、dates of his birth and death unknown→year of birth and death unknownに修正しました。
sen.e: TAIRA no Korehira (year of birth and death unknown) was a busho (a Japanese military commander) during the Heian period.
He was the fourth son of TAIRA no Sadamori.
He was the fourth son of TAIRA no Sadamori.
He was the fourth son of TAIRA no Sadamori.

sen.j: 子に平正度、平正済、平正輔がある。
sen.e: He had four sons, TAIRA no Masanori, YAIRA no Masazumi, and TAIRA no Masasuke.
He had three sons, TAIRA no Masanori, TAIRA no Masazumi, and TAIRA no Masasuke.
sen.cmt: four sons→three sons、YAIRA→TAIRAに修正しました。
sen.e: He had three sons, TAIRA no Masanori, TAIRA no Masazumi, and TAIRA no Masasuke.

sen.j: 官位は、従四位上、下野国守、伊勢国守、上野国介、常陸国介。
sen.e: His official court rank included the Jushiijo (the Junior Fourth Rank), the Shimotsuke no kuni no kami (the governor of Shimotsuke Province), the Ise no kuni no kami (the governor of Ise Province), the Kozuke no kuni no suke (the assistant governor of Kozuke Province), and the Hitachi no kuni no suke (the assistant governor of Hitach Province).

His official court rank included Jushiinojo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade), Governor of Shimotsuke Province, Governor of Ise Province, Assistant Governor of Kozuke Province, and Assistant Governor of Hitachi Province.
sen.cmt: 「従四位上、下野国守、伊勢国守、上野国介、常陸国介」の表記を修正しました。
sen.e: His official court rank included Jushiinojo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade), Governor of Shimotsuke Province, Governor of Ise Province, Assistant Governor of Kozuke Province, and Assistant Governor of Hitachi Province.

sen.j: 伊勢国に地盤を築き伊勢平氏の祖となった。
sen.e: He established his foundation in the Ise Province and became the father of the Ise-Heishi (the Taira clan).
He established his foundation in Ise Province and became the father of the Ise-Heishi (the Taira clan).
He established his foundation in Ise Province and became the father of the Ise-Heishi (the Taira clan).

sen.j: 長徳4年（998年）、維衡は遥任の国司として下野守在任中であったが、伊勢国神郡において同族の平致頼（維衡の又従兄弟）と合戦を繰り広げた。
sen.e: In 998 AD, Korehira was in the post of the Shimotsuke no kami as Kokushi of Yonin (a provincial governor residing in the capital); however, he fought at Kamikoori (the precincts of a Shinto shrine) in the Ise Province against TAIRA no Munemori, who belonged to the same clan as Korehira and was also Korehira's second cousin.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 998, Korehira was in the post of Governor of Shimotsuke Province as Kokushi of Yonin (a provincial governor residing in the capital); however, he fought at Kamikori (the precincts of a Shinto shrine) in Ise Province against TAIRA no Muneyori, who belonged to the same clan as Korehira and was also Korehira's second cousin.
sen.cmt: 998 AD→998、the Shimotsuke no kami→Govenor of Shimotsuke Province、Kamikoori→Kamikori、TAIRA no Munemori→TAIRA no Muneyoriに修正、in Ise Provinceとしました。
sen.e: In 998, Korehira was in the post of Governor of Shimotsuke Province as Kokushi of Yonin (a provincial governor residing in the capital); however, he fought at Kamikori (the precincts of a Shinto shrine) in Ise Province against TAIRA no Muneyori, who belonged to the same clan as Korehira and was also Korehira's second cousin.

sen.j: 後に両者ともに朝廷に召し出され尋問を受け、維衡は過状（詫び状）を提出し淡路国へ移郷となった。
sen.e: Later, both Korehira and Munemori were brought to the Imperial Court for a hearing, and Korehira submitted Kajo (a letter of appology) and transferred to Awaji Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Later, both Korehira and Muneyori were brought to the Imperial Court for a hearing, and Korehira submitted Kajo (a letter of appology) and was transferred to Awaji Province.
sen.cmt: Munemori→Muneyori、transferred to was transferred toに修正しました。
sen.e: Later, both Korehira and Muneyori were brought to the Imperial Court for a hearing, and Korehira submitted Kajo (a letter of appology) and was transferred to Awaji Province.

sen.j: その後、間もなく召還され、寛弘3年（1006年）1月28日 (旧暦)の除目で右大臣藤原顕光が伊勢守に推挙した。
sen.e: Before long, Korehira was called back to the Imperial Court and recommended to the position of the Ise no kami by the Udaijin (the Minister of the right) FUJIWARA no Akimitsu at the Jimoku (a ceremony for appointing officials) on January 28, 1006.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Before long, Korehira was called back to the Imperial Court and recommended to the position of Governor of Ise Province by Udaijin (Minister of the Right) FUJIWARA no Akimitsu at the Jimoku (a ceremony for appointing officials) on March 6, 1006.
sen.cmt: the position of the Ise no kami→the position of Governor of Ise Provinceとし、「右大臣」の表記を修正、旧暦→新暦に修正しました。
sen.e: Before long, Korehira was called back to the Imperial Court and recommended to the position of Governor of Ise Province by Udaijin (Minister of the Right) FUJIWARA no Akimitsu at the Jimoku (a ceremony for appointing officials) on March 6, 1006.

sen.j: しかし、「同族である致頼と伊勢国における覇権を巡り、数度に渡って抗争を展開していた」ことを理由に左大臣藤原道長が強硬に反対する。
sen.e: However, Sadaijin Fujiwara no Michinaga strongly opposed the recommendation because Korehira fought against Muneyori, who belonged to the same family as Korehira, over the hegemony in the Ise Province several times over the years.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) FUJIWARA no Michinaga strongly opposed the recommendation because Korehira fought against Muneyori, who belonged to the same family as Korehira, over the hegemony in Ise Province several times over the years.
sen.cmt: Sadaijinの補足を追加、Fujiwara no Michinaga→FUJIWARA no Michinagaに修正、余分なスペース消去、in Ise Provinceとしました。
sen.e: However, Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) FUJIWARA no Michinaga strongly opposed the recommendation because Korehira fought against Muneyori, who belonged to the same family as Korehira, over the hegemony in Ise Province several times over the years.

sen.j: このため担当の係も任官手続きを行わなかったが、何らかの手違いで維衡の名が書き入れられた状態で清書、奏上されてしまった。
sen.e: Therefore, the official in charge did not finish the paper work necessary for his appointment; however, Korehira's name was somehow added to the list of appointees by mistake, a fair copy was created, and the copy was reported to the Emperor.

Therefore, the official in charge did not finish the paper work necessary for his appointment; however, Korehira's name was somehow added to the list of appointees by mistake, a fair copy was created, and the copy was reported to the Emperor.

Therefore, the official in charge did not finish the paper work necessary for his appointment; however, Korehira's name was somehow added to the list of appointees by mistake, a fair copy was created, and the copy was reported to the Emperor.

sen.j: そのまま天皇の裁可が下ったため訂正することもできず、道長も承認せざるを得なかった。
sen.e: The fair copy received the Emperor's official approval without correction and, thus, Michinaga had to accept Korehira's appointment.
The fair copy received the Emperor's official approval without correction and, thus, Michinaga had to accept Korehira's appointment.
Since the fair copy without correction was approved officially by the Emperor, Michinaga had no choice but accepting Korehira's appointment.

sen.j: なお、このような経緯があったためか、維衡はわずか二ヶ月で伊勢守の任を解かれている。
sen.e: However, Korehira was removed from his position as the Ise no kami after only 2 months since there was such disfavor concerning his appointment.
However, Korehira was removed from his position as Govenor of Ise Province after only two months since there was such disfavor concerning his appointment.
sen.cmt: 2をスペルアウト、the Ise no kami→Govenor of Ise Provinceとしました。
sen.e: However, Korehira was removed from his position as Govenor of Ise Province after only two months since there was such disfavor concerning his appointment.

sen.j: その後、長和年間から治安 (元号)年間（1012年‐1023年）にかけて上野介、常陸介を歴任している。
sen.e: Later, Korehira successively held positions as the Kozuke no suke and the Hitachi no suke from 1012 AD to 1023 AD.
Later, Korehira successively held positions as Assistant Governor of Kozuke Province and Assistant Governor of Hitachi Province from 1012 to 1023.
sen.cmt: the Kozuke no suke and the Hitachi no suke→Assistant Governor of Kozuke Province and Assistant Governor of Hitachi Provinceとし、ADを削除しました。
sen.e: Later, Korehira successively held positions as Assistant Governor of Kozuke Province and Assistant Governor of Hitachi Province from 1012 to 1023.

sen.j: 没年は不明であるが、『尊卑分脈』には85歳で卒去したと記されている。
sen.e: His age at death is unknown; however, "Sonpi Bunmyaku" (a Japanese genealogical text) determined that he died at the age of 85.

sen.j: 後世の説話集『十訓抄』には優れた武士として、源頼信・藤原保昌・平致頼と並んで挙げられている。
sen.e: "Jikkinsho" (a collection of anecdotes in future generations) described him as an excellent samurai as well as MINAMOTO no Yorinobu, FUJIWARA no Yasumasa, and TAIRA no Muneyori.

sen.j: この四人がもし、互いに相争うのならば、必ず命を失うはずだと書かれている。
sen.e: "Jikkinsho" mentioned if four of these people ended up fighting each other, Korehira would certainly lose his life.

sen.j: なお、伊勢国における争いはそれぞれの子息（維衡の子正輔と致頼の子平致経）の代にまで引き継がれる。
sen.e: Furthermore, the fight in the Ise Province continued even into their son's generation (Masasuke, Korehira's son, and Taira no Munetsuke, Muneyori's son).

sen.e: Furthermore, the fight in Ise Province continued even into their son's generation (Masasuke, Korehira's son, and TAIRA no Munetsune, Muneyori's son).

sen.e: Furthermore, the fight in Ise Province continued even into their son's generation (Masasuke, Korehira's son, and TAIRA no Munetsune, Muneyori's son).

sen.j: しかし、致経が比叡山横川で出家し、治安 (元号)3年（1023年）に亡くなるに及んで、維衡一派の覇権が確立し、伊勢平氏として発展する。
sen.e: However, the hegemony by the Korehira clan was established and developed into the Ise Taira clan after Munetsuke became a priest of Yokokawa in Hiei-zan Mountain and died in 1023 AD.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, the hegemony by Korehira's group was established and developed into the Ise-Heishi after Munetsune became a priest at Yokawa on Mt. Hiei and died in 1023.

sen.e: Later, Taira no Kiyomori came from the lineage of this clan and built the golden age.
